title: Triangle Angle
text: We solved for the $$x$$ and $$y$$ components for the final vector R, now we just need to use the inverse function of the tangent function to find the angle with respect to the third qudrant and the $$x$$ axis.

title: Apply Arctan Function
text: As in the last question we've already calculated the $$x$$ component of the vector $$Rx=12cos\left(70\right)+20cos\left(40\right)=19.4$$, and $$y$$ component $$Ry=20sin\left(40\right)-12sin\left(70\right)=1.57$$. Solve $${tan}^{\left(-1\right)} \frac{1.57}{19.4}$$
